About_The_Wiki.name: About the Wiki
About_The_Wiki.description: The wiki you see now is the product of months of design, iteration, and dedication. Take a moment to learn about what makes it so special!
About_The_Wiki.image-alt: A website editor open with the Miami University iGEM home page code on it.

Attributions.name: Attributions
Attributions.description: Every member of the Miami University iGEM contributed in a meaningful and impactful way. See how and what each person attributed to that made our project what it is!
Attributions.image-alt: A group of people sitting around a table eating.

Collaborations.name: Collaborations
Collaborations.description: In order to help out other teams we joined up to share information and create tools for future teams. Explore more below.
Collaborations.image-alt: A man writing in a book with his phone in one hand and pen in the other.

Communication.name: Communication
Communication.description: We wanted to share our project with others and have an open discussion. Learn how we shared with other communities and what we learned!
Communication.image-alt: The 4C team standing in a lab with masks on.

Contribution.name: Contributions
Contribution.description: Through our work we were able to add parts of our project to the registry to aid future teams in their research. See how we were able to aid in the iGEM registry.
Contribution.image-alt: A group of people sitting around a table eating.

Description.name: Description
Description.description: The world depends on high agricultural productivity to provide food and resources to local and global communities. However, global demand for crop production is expected to increase dramatically. Learn how Miami University's CROP could increase the yields of crop plants.
Description.image-alt: A fly over picture of farm equipment.

Design.name: Design
Design.description: Our team looked into designing different pathways to enhance photosynthesis of crops in order to increase crop yield. Learn more about our designs!
Design.image-alt: A close up of blue-green algae.

Education.name: Education
Education.description: Not only did the Miami University iGEM team work to make a phenomenal project, we also spent an exceptional amount of time teaching others about plant synthetic biology! Take a moment to learn more about that on our education page!
Education.image-alt: A box with the text 'Questions on GMO?' written on it.

Engineering.name: Engineering
Engineering.description: In order to find a way to improve crop yield we designed, built, and tested photosynthesis enhancement. See our success and what we learned!
Engineering.image-alt: A man cutting a grassy plant.

Human_Practices.name: Human Practices
Human_Practices.description: The best way we can show respect to our community is to listen to them. GMOs are a controversial topic, and we do not want to ignore the fears of our community members. Learn more about that here and how we reached out to the community!
Human_Practices.image-alt: Avery Imes presenting for the residents of the Knolls of Oxford in Oxford.

Implementation.name: Implementation
Implementation.description: Communities throughout the world struggle to meet daily nutritional needs. One solution is to improve crop yield by optimizing the process of photosynthesis, the use of light energy to form sugar molecules. Learn more about that here!
Implementation.image-alt: A field of golden rice during sunset.

Model.name: Computational Modeling
Model.description: Using programming we were able to test out theories on different pathways in order to help out the wet lab work. Explore the different pathways.

Notebook.name: Notebook
Notebook.description: Our lab team kept an exceptional record of everything throughout the project. See the exact details of how our wet lab work was conducted.
Notebook.image-alt: A closeup of a grain of wheat.

Parts.name: Parts
Parts.description: See our full list of parts entered into the iGEM Registry.

Plant.name: Plant Synthetic Biology
Plant.description: Our project explored photosynthetic redesign in a cyanobacteria chassis for implementation into plants. Explore our overview of how we aimed to achieve the plant special award.
Plant.image-alt: A close up of a grain of wheat.

Proof_Of_Concept.name: Proof of Concept
Proof_Of_Concept.description: Explore the experiments conducted by our wet lab team and see the results of our genetic modification in cyanobacteria!

Safety.name: Safety
Safety.description: With any project, thinking carefully about and managing any risks is a vital step. Between the inherit risks of our project as well as challenges created by the COVID-19 pandemic, our team had to be thoughtful. Learn how the Miami University team handled safety and risk here!
Safety.image-alt: Daria sitting in lab with a black mask on.

Team.name: Team
Team.description: The work done by Miami University's iGEM team was made possible by a team of dedicate and passionate students and advisors from a range of different STEM subject domains! Take a moment to learn more about Miami University's committed team!
Team.image-alt: The entire Miami University iGEM team posing in Pearson Hall.
